#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=6. Conclusions
#Text=This paper investigated customer satisfaction in green hotels through travellers ’ online review analysis .
#Text=We used machine learning techniques to analyze the online text-based reviews and numerical data analysis .
#Text=SOM was used for travelers ’ segmentation in both green spa and non-spa hotels .
#Text=LDA was used for the identification of the main satisfaction dimensions ( topics ) from the text-based reviews .
#Text=We also used TOPSIS to rank the main criteria for green hotel selection from numerical reviews .

#Text=The neuro-fuzzy system was then used to reveal the relative importance of the hotel features on the customers ’ satisfaction and find the importance role of spa services and its impact on the customers ’ satisfaction .

#Text=We investigated the role of spa services on the travellers ’ overall satisfaction in four main travelling groups , Travelled with Friends , Solo Travelers , Travelled with Family and Travelled as a Couple .
#Text=The data were collected from Malaysian green spa and non-spa hotels in the TripAdvisor platform .
#Text=The results showed that , in general , the travellers ’ satisfaction was relatively higher than in green spa hotels in relation to the green non-spa hotels .
#Text=This result was proved in four travelling groups , Travelled with Friends , Solo Travelers , Travelled with Family and Travelled as a Couple .

#Text=In our experimental analysis , we observed that travellers are relatively more satisfied in green spa hotels and accordingly provide a higher degree of overall ratings to the hotels with spa services .
#Text=This research has some limitations .
#Text=First , this study has considered only the data from TripAdvisor to investigate the role of spa services on customers ’ satisfaction .
#Text=The data from other social networking sites such as trivago.com , booking.com , and trip.com can further confirm the results of this study .
#Text=Second , this study only considered the Malaysian green spa and non-spa hotels to validate the proposed hypothesis .
#Text=The data from hotels registered in TripAdvisor for other developed and developing countries may better reveal the significance of spa services on customers ’ satisfaction .

#Text=Third , although our method was implemented to assess the travellers ’ satisfaction in green hotels , the proposed method can also be implemented for other types of hotels ( e. g. , non-green hotels with spa services ) and then comparisons are made for the travellers ’ satisfaction levels in different hotels ( i. e. , comparisons for travellers ’ satisfaction levels in green hotels with spa services and non-green hotels with spa services ) .
#Text=Fourth , four travelling groups have been considered for hypothesis evaluation .
#Text=Future studies can investigate the role of spa services on other travelling groups such as business travellers .
#Text=Fifth , this study does not investigate the role of spa services on the travelers ’ satisfaction from the gender perspective .
#Text=This can be an interesting investigation for future studies in the tourism context .
#Text=Sixth , our method was based on non-incremental learning techniques .

#Text=The use of deep learning approaches , Random Forest ( RF ) and incremental learning or the development of our method with incremental updates , especially in LDA and neuro-fuzzy learning techniques , can be effective in online reviews analysis .
#Text=This limitation could be a rich avenue for future research .

#Text=Besides the TOPSIS method , we can also consider group decision-making ( GDM ) and other multiple criteria decision-making methods such as the double normalization-based multiple aggregation ( DNMA ) method and the gained and lost dominance score ( GLDS ) method , to solve such problems .
#Text=Finally , multicollinearity phenomenon may occur due to the high correlations among the features of dataset which should be solved through appropriate learning techniques .
